title: Thank you very much for listening to us about Fiora's hair, Riot.
body:
Last step is to fix Royal Guard Fiora.

EDIT: I lied, what is that walk animation

replies.body: I'll admit, her splash and art are A LOT better. They actually slightly feel like Fiora, but I still think they could use a little touching up. Overall though, they are significantly better and I can live with these.

c: Yeah, I'm happy they changed Fiora's hair. It looks much better now!

I hope they also fix up Royal Guard Fiora.  I'm really disappointed because it was my favorite Fiora skin, and its the only one (aside from classic) where it feels like they didn't try to capture the spirit of the original skin. I liked the simplicity of the original Royal Guard skin; it looked very classy. On the new version, I really dislike the gaudy pendant and the overabundance of white frills. The big white frills just make her look very bloated- like she's wearing too many layers or something.

They actually got rid of the frills on the arms completely and in general toned down the colors/gaudiness. Also improved the face <.<

In general I think it looks a lot better.

http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-C3Fbk-bE78M/VbGDN4w-_CI/AAAAAAAAFUY/w3uocPeNVCQ/s1600/fiora1compare.jpg

I like the new hat better.

Even though the previously used biconre was more historically accurate, the new cavalier hat aligns better with the pop-culture 'musketeer look'.

Yeah, sorry about the traditional skin man...
You are mad. That'd require actual work!

While I'm thankful for Riot changing Fiora (some what) back to her previous look, this whole thing is why Riot gets a lot of negative feedback on the boards. We cant have Rioter say things like "the hair is too much work/too hard for the rigging on her in game model", or "this is the art style we are going with". Then get a massive negative feed back and wonder why that is. All of the arguments that were on the main board here (and Reddit) were also on the PBE. This might mean Riot needs to pay more attention to the PBE and be more fluid with their work in regards to the player base.

> [{quoted}](name=Retillin,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=h33cE9LN,comment-id=000c,timestamp=2015-07-26T12:19:51.875+0000)

We cant have Rioter say things like "the hair is too much work/too hard for the rigging on her in game model", or "this is the art style we are going with". Then get a massive negative feed back and wonder why that is. All of the arguments that were on the main board here (and Reddit) were also on the PBE. This might mean Riot needs to pay more attention to the PBE and be more fluid with their work in regards to the player base.

It also means that Riot needs to realize that faces are _incredibly important_ for recognition. That also includes hairstyles.

It'd be like giving Poppy a new model and removing her pigtails. Or getting rid of Darius' little white streak. Removing Evelynn's super-saiyan do.

Conversely, it'd be like showing Shen, Shaco, Morde, or Shaco's faces. You don't do that. _That's literally their thing_, much in the same way that bangs over one eye, with a red streak, was Fiora's thing. (But the former in different variations e.g Mask, helmet, clown mask, shawl/hood thing.)

The other stuff such as overall design applies to this too, but outfits can change as long as they're consistently similar, when they aren't skins.

To be fair, what was said was more in the line of "We are talking about it, bust most likely won't change it due to such and such", which sounds like trying to not yet commit to a 'we are going to do it, guys' answer, rather than saying that they would not do it.
Well Ironstylus did say that the hair was too hard for the rigging of the model in game. But we see that wasn't true...

Nah, this is the actual quote:

> That being said, we most likely will not be moving the hair part to where it was originally. Those are geometry changes that affect the UV's of the model and it can cause some compounding issues with the model itselve and rigging that was done to add a bit of bounce to her hair (from a technical standpoint it means re-exporting/deleting animations and that can gum up the process).

[Link to the quote.](https://np.reddit.com/r/leagueoflegends/comments/3e9mh6/fiora_model_is_being_worked_on_we_are_being/ctcz291)

He speaks of the potential consequences of changing the model, but never frames it as being 'too hard'.

Also, he is refering to the issue of moving the hair 'where it was originally', as in her actual in-game model, which is something they didn't do, but rather reached a compromise where she has a less covering version of the actual hairstyle.

For real though thank you to the team behind working on the splash and model for making changes to Fiora to get her where she is now.

I do agree that some changes still need to be made to royal guard. _(black hair please!)_ But you guys are doing an awesome job I really like the update and I hope the back lash doesn't keep you from making more stuff for Fiora!

The recent change is definitely a step in the right direction. I feel they need to change the hair and I'd be fine with it. Right now, it looks awkward, especially when viewing from above during gameplay.

Her other skins, Nightraven and Headmistress, the hair was kept true to the splash art. Why not Royal Guard?

#Never forget the real Fiora

Changing her walk to something more fluid and precise than exaggerated would be a better change to me. Even with some things off, as long as she communicates precise fencer I'm very okay
The exaggerated gait is probably for gameplay purposes. You can always tell where she is moving to, an important part of the minigame of her Duelist's Dance passive.

Interesting opinion.

My take on that leg was that she had placed her foot at the hand rail that we see to her right.

I also don't think she is suppossed to be fighting in that image, but rather showcasing her balance and agility by catching that rose petal with her blade.

Yeah, that's one assumption, and it would be really cool if we could see it.

my problem is that since I can't see it, and since the background is so indistinct from Fiora herself (it really does remind me of a character image layered over a background, Visual Novel style) the way the perspective works, I can't see where the handrail would go, neither can i really assume anything of how her foot goes.

I do admit that a foot on the handrail would be pretty damn fitting for her.

"Weirdly dancing around" is what fencers do. In fact, her new passive is "duelist's dance". Even though it also looks good with her legs down, I'd rather see her in action (in the middle of a fight) rather than posing for the camera.

If she's supposed to be in the middle of a fight, then maybe showing a full body shot and not just knees up would work, so it's very possible to see what the hell that leg is accomplishing.

Fencers may dance around, but they don't do the ballerina thing with legs weirdly jutting out to the side. They do the thing with legs behind each other so they have a slimmer profile which is harder to hit.

It really looks like a generic pose picked for the ease of drawing that particular general stance with those cutoff points than a concious decision.

It's still a travesty as far as I'm concerned. A traditional skin would be very very welcome.

(Yes I know they said they wouldn't do them anymore, but if they don't make an exception in this case then they can fuck right off).

Its not about having to think about making the plays its about how unrealistic it is, like think about it, who is gonna you hit all 4? and then it gets 10 times more impossible to try and do in a team fight.

1) You only have to hit 1 and then let them die for the full effect.
2) If you mark an enemy, your allies should also invest themselves in helping you for the sake of that huge heal, which can pretty much win a teamfight then and there. That play is a team effort with huge rewards.
3) In a 1v1, your Lunge gives you a lot of opportunities to jump around and through the enemy to hit all the points if they try to stand and duel you. If they run, new Bladeworks gives you a chance to slow and Lunge to get more damage off. Dueling is where Fiora shines: they stay, you win, they run, you can probably still win.
Even if hitting all 4 is 'impossible' the first time you try, experienced Fiora players will have an easier time with it not to mention that her rework gives her tools outside of her ultimate to work with (unlike old Fiora, who was picked for her ultimate _only_).
